intro: Quamoclidion froebelii subsp. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth quamoclidion, is a rare and specialized plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, glabrous leaves. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in montane forests. Its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered, highlighting the need for its protection.
